1562000931_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [pexo](#comment_112_1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC):  ZeroNet gets popular and nazis come flooding in. Since they tend to be more active then everyone else the voting activity(or just brute numbers) will crush all competition when it comes to voting. [...]

There haven't been any Nazis for over 70 years. There are definitely folks here who wanna gas the kikes, though! \o

I haven't seen any realistic suggestion (though maybe I just missed it) for preventing a situation where you have multiple identities run by one person voting for candidate identities who may all be run by one person, or a few people. Or people voting for themselves with straw identities. 

I don't see the requirement that for a vote to be counted, it must have been made by an account that has made "good" comments before Jul. 1, operationalized anywhere. What's a "good" comment? That guy with the long username that starts with an h is a prolific poster, and he has received upvotes for his posts and comments, but "he's" either a bot or a schizophrenic who can't form a coherent sentence. I think everything he posts is spam. Other posters don't.

But, then, is this really a vote? It's suggested that people should explain why they're voting for the person(s) for whom they're voting. So is there some weighting? And how will that be done? Votes don't usually require explanations. 

I checked the ZeroTalk forums for some of the other languages I speak. I didn't see this posted in any of them. Do only English-speakers get to decide the future of this network and the software? Or will they get some information about it in their own languages and an opportunity to vote when we--rightful rulers of ZeroNet by virtue of our knowledge of Ye Glouryous Englisch Langwidge--have hashed out all of the parameters?

If I were nofish, I'd scuttle this idea, at least without serious modification, and frankly, I'd be pretty offended if it were proposed in this manner without having been run by me first. But maybe he'll think it's peachy.
